text:
The Forest Department officials on Friday rescued an injured monitor lizard at Udumalpet and released into the forest after giving treatment.

District Forest Officer A. Periasamy told The Hindu that the monitor lizard, a scheduled wild animal under Wildlife Protection Act, was found with injuries from a coconut field.

It has been found that the monitor lizard was attacked by stray dogs.

The animal was given treatment at the veterinary hospital near Udumalpet. It was released into the forest near Chinnar,” he said.
title: Monitor lizard rescued
